article_title: Washington, D.C., holiday gives taxpayers extra time to file returns
article_text:
IRS marks Emancipation Day on Friday in nation’s capital

Monday is deadline to file returns or request an extension

State tax board says about 6 million returns yet to be filed

article_metadata.news-keywords: Internal Revenue Service, IRS, FTB, California Franchise Tax Board, tax returns, extended deadline, Emancipation Day, Washington, D.C., Affordable Care Act, income taxes
article_metadata.description: Still haven’t filed your income tax returns? Relax, you still have time. Historically, April 15 is the deadline to file returns, but the deadline was pushed to April 18 this year because Washington, D.C., celebrated Emancipation Day on Friday. In simple terms, it means that Internal Revenue Service offices in the nation’s capital were closed Friday, giving everyone else an extra couple of days to make Monday’s filing deadline.
article_metadata.title: Washington, D.C., holiday gives taxpayers extra time to file returns | The Sacramento Bee
